item.title: 负债累累的全球房地产市场被迫提前销售 - M&G
item.description:
M&G Real Estate (MNG.L) forecasts it is "a matter of time" before global property markets face greater volumes of forced selling, with banks increasingly reluctant to refinance troubled or lower quality assets at current interest rates.翻译:M&G Real Estate (MNG.L)预测，全球房地产市场面临更大规模的强制抛售只是“时间问题”，银行越来越不愿意以当前利率为问题或质量较低的资产进行再融资。

Property developers in China, Germany and Sweden have in particular suffered as a result of a sharp rise in borrowing costs in recent years, with some projects financed at rock-bottom rates now close to, or breaching, key loan terms.翻译:中国、 德国和 瑞典的房地产开发商尤其因近年来借贷成本急剧上升而遭受损失，一些以最低利率融资的项目现已接近或违反了关键贷款条款。

"We had it really good in the last 25 years but now financing costs are higher and returns will have to come either from rental growth, or from adding value to properties," Jose Pellicer, head of investment strategy at M&G Real Estate said.翻译:M&G Real Estate 投资策略主管 Jose Pellicer 表示：“过去 25 年我们的情况确实不错，但现在融资成本更高，回报要么来自租金增长，要么来自房产增值。”

"We are in a new period of real estate investment that will require a new mindset," he told Reuters before the publication of the firm's Global Real Estate Outlook on Tuesday.翻译:“我们正处于房地产投资的新时期，需要新的思维方式，”他在周二发布该公司的全球房地产展望之前告诉路透社。

Pellicer said a recovery in the Chinese market would likely take time, although its troubles were cyclical rather than structural and key growth drivers like urbanisation were intact.翻译:佩利瑟表示，中国市场的复苏可能需要时间，尽管其问题是周期性的而非结构性的，而且城市化等关键增长动力完好无损。

In Europe, Germany would likely see the largest volume of forced property sales, Pellicer predicted, with the market reeling more than others from higher costs of real estate debt and a sharp repricing of assets.翻译:佩利塞预测，在欧洲，德国可能会出现最大量的强制出售房产，该市场比其他市场因房地产债务成本上升和资产急剧重新定价而受到的影响更大。

Nearly 40% of outstanding British commercial real estate loans are due to mature in 2024 and 2025, where average real estate values have fallen by over 20% since mid-2022, the report said, citing data from Bayes Business School.翻译:报告援引贝叶斯商学院的数据称，近 40% 的英国未偿商业房地产贷款将于 2024 年和 2025 年到期，自 2022 年中期以来，平均房地产价值已下降超过 20%。

Some borrowers would be unable "to meet interest coverage ratio covenants for loan renewals" and may have difficulty finding refinancing options open to them.翻译:一些借款人将无法“满足续贷的利息覆盖率契约”，并且可能难以找到向他们开放的再融资选择。

M&G, which manages 31 billion pounds ($39 billion) in property assets, said this might provide an opportunity for alternative lenders to step in.翻译:M&G 管理着 310 亿英镑（390 亿美元）的房地产资产，该公司表示，这可能为另类贷款机构介入提供了机会。

"Real estate debt is becoming an increasingly attractive investment proposition," Pellicer said.

OFFICE WOES

The global office market has been rattled by the bankruptcy of WeWork, darkening the outlook for the largest business hubs, where rising vacancies are already hitting investors.翻译:全球写字楼市场因WeWork 破产而陷入动荡，令大型商业中心的前景黯淡，这些中心的空置率上升已经给投资者带来了打击。

But not all offices are equal, Pellicer said.翻译:但佩利瑟说，并非所有办公室都是平等的。

Low-quality offices are a risky investment globally, as employees remain slow to abandon home working after the COVID-19 pandemic and buildings face costly upgrades to meet sustainability targets, the report showed.翻译:报告显示，在全球范围内，低质量的办公室是一项风险投资，因为在 COVID-19 大流行之后，员工放弃在家工作的速度仍然缓慢，而且建筑物面临着昂贵的升级以实现可持续发展目标。

The United States is in a far worse position than Asia or Europe, with downtown vacancy rates in key cities typically between 25-30% versus single digits in major European business hubs, Pellicer said.翻译:Pellicer 表示，美国的情况比亚洲或欧洲要糟糕得多，主要城市的市中心空置率通常在 25-30% 之间，而欧洲主要商业中心的空置率仅为个位数。

U.S. office-based working is at only 50% of pre-pandemic levels, the report cited real estate services firm JLL (JLL.N) as estimating, while numbers in Europe have recovered to 75%.翻译:报告援引房地产服务公司仲量联行(JLL.N)的估计，美国的办公室工作水平仅为疫情前水平的 50%，而欧洲的这一数字已恢复至 75%。

M&G said a focus on environmental, social and governance credentials and central locations was creating a market of prime, ultra-prime, and secondary space, with non-prime properties facing "significant leasing risk and weak rental prospects".翻译:M&G 表示，对环境、社会和治理资质以及中心位置的关注正在创造一个优质、超优质和次要空间市场，非优质房产面临“巨大的租赁风险和疲软的租赁前景”。

($1 = 0.8025 pounds)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.8025 英镑）

Reporting by Carolyn Cohn and Sinead Cruise; Editing by Alexander Smith翻译:卡罗琳·科恩和西尼德·克鲁斯报道；亚历山大·史密斯编辑

item.title: 中国在供应链博览会上反击西方的去风险策略
item.description:
Summary:
  • China warns protectionism, geopolitical tensions threaten supply chains
  • China says wants closer supply chain ties with all
  • US, EU greenfield investment into China dropped $100 billion between 2018-2022 - study
  • US, EU 'de-risking' strategies overplay risk level - analysts
翻译:概括：
  • 中国警告保护主义、地缘政治紧张局势威胁供应链
  • 中国表示希望与所有国家建立更紧密的供应链联系
  • 研究显示，2018年至2022年间，美国和欧盟对华绿地投资减少1000亿美元
  • 分析师称美国和欧盟的“去风险”策略夸大了风险水平

China opposes protectionism and wants to strengthen supply chains with all countries, Premier Li Qiang said on Tuesday, as a growing number of nations voice concern at how much their supply chains depend on the world's second largest economy.翻译:中国总理李强周二表示，中国反对保护主义，希望加强与所有国家的供应链，越来越多的国家对其供应链对世界第二大经济体的依赖程度表示担忧。

Li's comments comes amid calls over the past year from the United States and the European Union to reduce their dependence on China in certain sectors and "de-risk" their supply chains, as well as efforts to cut off Chinese enterprises from some advanced semiconductors.翻译:李克强发表上述言论之际，美国和欧盟在过去一年中呼吁减少在某些领域对中国的依赖并“降低供应链风险” ，并努力切断中国企业对某些先进半导体的供应。

"We are willing to build closer production and industrial supply chain partnerships with all countries," Li told the first China International Supply Chain Expo (CISCE), adding that the international community needs to be "more wary of the challenges and risks brought about by protectionism and uncontrolled globalisation."翻译:李克强在首届中国国际供应链博览会上表示：“我们愿意与各国建立更紧密的生产和产业供应链伙伴关系。”他补充说，国际社会需要“更加警惕供应链带来的挑战和风险”。保护主义和不受控制的全球化。”

Recent geopolitical tensions, from Russia's war in Ukraine to concerns over a future Chinese invasion of Taiwan, have led a growing number of foreign businesses to opt against expanding their supply chains in China, instead directing investment to countries including India, Mexico and Vietnam that enjoy better ties with the United States, a strategy known as China-plus-one.翻译:最近的地缘政治紧张局势，从俄罗斯在乌克兰的战争，到对中国未来入侵台湾的担忧， 导致越来越多的外国企业选择不扩大在中国的供应链，而是将投资转向印度、墨西哥和越南等享有便利条件的国家。与美国建立更好的关系，这一战略被称为“中国加一”。

The expo, organised by the state-run China Council for the Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT), is Beijing's latest bid to increase foreign investment in China, which has dropped to historic lows.翻译:此次进博会由国营的中国国际贸易促进委员会（CCPIT）主办，是北京为增加对华外国投资而采取的最新举措，目前中国的外国投资已降至历史低点。

The value of announced U.S. and European greenfield investment into China dropped to less than $20 billion last year, from a peak of $120 billion in 2018, according to Rhodium Group, while investment into India shot up by some $65 billion or 400% between 2021 and 2022.翻译:根据荣鼎集团的数据，美国和欧洲宣布的对华绿地投资额从 2018 年 1200 亿美元的峰值降至去年的不足 200 亿美元，而对印度的投资在 2021 年至 2021 年期间猛增约 650 亿美元，即 400%。 2022 年。

Despite this decrease, China remains an attractive option: a survey conducted by HSBC bank at the China International Import Expo (CIIE) earlier this month showed 45% of firms expect to expand their supply chain in China over the next year.翻译:尽管下降，中国仍然是一个有吸引力的选择：汇丰银行本月早些时候在中国国际进口博览会（CIIE）上进行的一项调查显示，45%的企业预计明年将扩大在中国的供应链。

"I think there is a lot of hyperbole around this. And I'm not sure whether the (de-risking) measures the EU or U.S. are considering match the scale of the risk," said Dan Marks, research fellow for energy security at the Royal United Services think tank.翻译:“我认为这有很多夸张的成分。而且我不确定欧盟或美国正在考虑的（去风险）措施是否与风险的规模相匹配，”能源安全研究员丹·马克斯说。皇家联合军种智囊团。

An apparent improvement in U.S.-Sino ties, after Chinese President Xi Jinping recently met U.S. President Joe Biden and participated in the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) Summit, should also help reinforce China's position as a key manufacturing hub.翻译:在中国国家主席习近平最近会见美国总统乔·拜登并参加亚太经合组织（APEC）峰会之后，中美关系明显改善，也应有助于巩固中国作为主要制造业中心的地位。

Zhang Shaogang, a CCPIT official who was part of the Chinese delegation at the APEC summit, said last week that 20% of the foreign firms exhibiting at the supply chain expo were U.S.-based, and included Amazon (AMZN.O), Apple (AAPL.O), Tesla (TSLA.O), and Intel (INTC.O).翻译:参加APEC峰会的中国代表团成员、中国贸促会官员张绍刚上周表示，参加供应链博览会的外国企业中有20%是美国企业，其中包括亚马逊(AMZN.O) 、苹果(Apple )等。 AAPL.O） 、特斯拉（TSLA.O）和英特尔（INTC.O） 。

"We wholeheartedly hope U.S. businesses can...while actively realising their own development, also positively promote the healthy, stable, and long-term development of U.S.-China relations," Zhang said.翻译:我们衷心希望美国企业在积极实现自身发展的同时，也积极推动美中关系健康稳定长期发展。

Reporting by Eduardo Baptista and Joe Cash; Editing by Jamie Freed and Miral Fahmy翻译:爱德华多·巴普蒂斯塔和乔·卡什的报道；编辑：杰米·弗里德和米拉尔·法赫米

item.title: 中国Shein申请美国IPO，对投资者胃口构成重大考验——消息人士
item.description:
Summary:
  • Shein yet to determine IPO size, valued at over $60 bln in May
  • IPO comes amid challenging markets and U.S. scrutiny
  • Fast-fashion retailers still behind Amazon on sales
翻译:概括：
  • Shein 尚未确定 IPO 规模，5 月份估值超过 600 亿美元
  • IPO 正值充满挑战的市场和美国的审查
  • 快时尚零售商的销售额仍落后于亚马逊

Fashion company Shein has confidentially filed to go public in the United States, according to two sources familiar with the matter, in what is likely to be one of the most valuable China-founded companies to list in New York.翻译:据两位知情人士透露，时装公司 Shein 已秘密申请在美国上市，这可能是在纽约上市的最有价值的中国创办公司之一。

Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley have been hired as lead underwriters on the initial public offering (IPO), and Singapore-based Shein could launch its new share sale some time in 2024, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，高盛、摩根大通和摩根士丹利已被聘请为首次公开募股 (IPO) 的主承销商，总部位于新加坡的 Shein 可能会在 2024 年的某个时候启动新股发行。

Shein has not determined the size of the deal or the valuation at IPO, the sources said. Bloomberg reported earlier this month it targeted up to $90 billion in the float.翻译:消息人士称，Shein 尚未确定交易规模或 IPO 估值。彭博社本月早些时候报道称，其发行目标为 900 亿美元。

Shein and the banks declined to comment.翻译:Shein 和银行拒绝置评。

The company founded in mainland China in 2012 was valued at more than $60 billion in a May fundraising, down by a third from a funding round last year.翻译:该公司于 2012 年在中国大陆成立，在 5 月份的融资中估值超过 600 亿美元，比去年的融资轮次下降了三分之一。

The most valuable China-founded enterprise to go public in the United States so far is ride-hailing giant Didi Global's (92Sy.MU) debut in 2021 at $68 billion valuation.翻译:迄今为止在美国上市市值最高的中资企业是网约车巨头滴滴出行（92Sy.MU），该公司于 2021 年首次亮相，估值为 680 亿美元。

The fast-fashion giant's move to go public in the U.S. comes as the market for initial public offerings is struggling to rebound after a string of lacklustre stock market debuts.翻译:这家快时尚巨头决定在美国上市之际，首次公开募股(IPO)市场在经历了一系列低迷的股市上市后正艰难反弹。

In recent months there were four major IPOs, and three of them disappointed investors.翻译:近几个月来，共有四起大型IPO，其中三起令投资者感到失望。

Shares of German sandal-maker Birkenstock (BIRK.N), grocery delivery app Instacart (CART.O) and chip designer Arm Holdings dropped below their IPO prices in the days that followed debuts, though Arm's shares are now trading above that price.翻译:德国凉鞋制造商 Birkenstock (BIRK.N) 、杂货配送应用 Instacart (CART.O)和芯片设计商 Arm Holdings 的股价在上市后的几天内均跌破了 IPO 价格，尽管 Arm 的股价目前高于该价格。

"It doesn't strike me as the most opportune time for Shein to come public, but if they need capital the markets are open ... and investor sentiment has been more positive than it was a few weeks ago," said Jason Benowitz, senior portfolio manager at CI Roosevelt.翻译:杰森·贝诺维茨 (Jason Benowitz) 表示：“在我看来，这并不是 Shein 上市的最佳时机，但如果他们需要资金，市场就会开放……而且投资者情绪比几周前更加积极。” CI Roosevelt 的高级投资组合经理。

"When investors can review the financials, I would expect to see pretty strong growth historically ... the key question will be if they can kind of maintain the pace or to continue to gain market share going forward," he said.翻译:他表示：“当投资者能够审视财务状况时，我预计会看到历史上相当强劲的增长……关键问题是他们是否能够保持这种步伐或继续获得未来的市场份额。”

U.S. IPOs have raised about $23.64 billion so far this year, compared with $21.3 billion during the same period last year. In 2021, the comparable number was $300 billion when the IPO market was close to its peak.

SUPPLY CHAINS

Shein had started low-profile roadshows for the float in the U.S., said one of the sources, who declined to be identified due to confidentiality restraints.翻译:一位因保密限制而拒绝透露姓名的消息人士称，Shein 已在美国开始低调路演。

It is not immediately clear if the company has filed with China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC) for the U.S. IPO. Chinese companies need to receive clearance from the regulator before going ahead with their offshore offerings.翻译:目前尚不清楚该公司是否已向中国证监会（CSRC）提交赴美IPO申请。中国公司在进行离岸发行之前需要获得监管机构的许可。

CSRC did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:中国证监会没有立即回应置评请求。

"As it is a significant and highly disruptive player in the retail space, Shein will attract a lot of investor interest," said GlobalData managing director Neil Saunders.翻译:GlobalData 董事总经理 Neil Saunders 表示：“由于 Shein 是零售领域的重要且极具颠覆性的参与者，因此将吸引大量投资者的兴趣。”

Reuters in July reported that Shein - which attempted to list in the U.S. in 2020 but shelved that plan - has been working with at least three investment banks about a potential IPO.翻译:路透社 7 月报道称，Shein 曾试图于 2020 年在美国上市，但搁置了该计划。该公司一直在与至少三家投资银行就潜在的 IPO 进行合作。

In August, Republican attorneys general from 16 U.S. states asked the Securities and Exchange Commission to audit Shein's supply chain for the alleged use of forced labor ahead of its potential IPO.

'GOOD TIME TO LIST'

Known for its $10 tops and $5 biker shorts, Shein ships the majority of its products directly from China to shoppers by air in individually addressed packages.翻译:Shein 的大部分产品采用独立地址包装，通过空运直接从中国运送给购物者。翻译:Shein 以其 10 美元的上衣和 5 美元的机车短裤而闻名，其大部分产品都通过单独地址的包装直接从中国空运给购物者。

The direct shipping strategy helped the firm avoid unsold inventory piling up in warehouses and avoid import tax in the United States, one of its biggest markets, as it allows the e-tailer to take advantage of the "de minimis" provision that exempts cheap products from tariffs.翻译:直接运输策略帮助该公司避免了未售出的库存堆积在仓库中，并避免了其最大市场之一美国的进口税，因为它允许电子零售商利用免除廉价产品的“最低限度”条款来自关税。

Some critics say the provision allows companies to evade higher tariffs on Chinese goods.翻译:一些批评人士表示，该条款允许企业逃避对中国商品征收的更高关税。

Fast fashion retailers have been gaining popularity in the United States, with Shein taking away market share from the likes of Gap (GPS.N) as shoppers look for fresher styles.翻译:快时尚零售商在美国越来越受欢迎，随着购物者寻求更新鲜的款式，Shein 抢走了 Gap (GPS.N)等品牌的市场份额。

In August, Shein partnered with SPARC Group, a joint venture between Forever 21 owner Authentic Brands (AUTH.N) and mall operator Simon Property (SPG.N), in an attempt to expand their market reach.翻译:8 月，Shein 与 SPARC Group 合作，SPARC Group 是 Forever 21 所有者 Authentic Brands (AUTH.N)和购物中心运营商 Simon Property (SPG.N)的合资企业，试图扩大其市场覆盖范围。

Shein along with Temu.com, however, have not been able to turn shopper visits into sales and are far behind market leader Amazon.com (AMZN.O) on that score.翻译:然而，Shein 和Temu.com 未能将购物者访问转化为销售额，在这一点上远远落后于市场领导者亚马逊(AMZN.O) 。

Sumeet Singh, an analyst at Aequitas Research who publishes on SmartKarma, said big companies like Shein were tapping capital markets due to peaking interest rates and ahead of possible changes in U.S. regulations for small retailers.翻译:Aequitas Research 分析师苏米特·辛格 (Sumeet Singh) 在 SmartKarma 上发表文章，他表示，由于利率达到顶峰，而且美国对小型零售商的监管可能发生变化，像 Shein 这样的大公司正在利用资本市场。

"It's probably as good as it gets for them right now," he said.翻译:“这对他们来说可能是现在最好的了，”他说。

Shein's confidential U.S. IPO filing was first reported by China's Shanghai Securities Journal last week. The Wall Street Journal earlier on Monday confirmed the report citing sources.翻译:中国《上海证券报》上周首次报道了 Shein 的美国 IPO 保密申请。 《华尔街日报》周一早些时候援引消息人士的话说证实了这一报道。

item.title: 中国海军舰艇在安全紧张局势加剧之际访问缅甸
item.description:
Three Chinese navy ships have arrived in Myanmar on a goodwill visit as part of renewed Chinese defence engagement amid Chinese concern about a surge of fighting between Myanmar junta forces and insurgents near the Chinese border.翻译:由于中国对缅甸军政府部队与中国边境附近叛乱分子之间的战斗激增感到担忧，三艘中国海军舰艇已抵达缅甸进行友好访问，这是中国重新进行防务活动的一部分。

The guided-missile destroyer Zibo and the guided-missile frigate Jingzhou were escorted by a Myanmar frigate to docks in Myanmar's main city of Yangon on Monday, China's People's Liberation Navy (PLAN) said in a statement.翻译:中国海军在一份声明中表示，周一，淄博号导弹驱逐舰和荆州号导弹护卫舰在一艘缅甸护卫舰的护航下抵达缅甸主要城市仰光码头。

The 700-strong force, on a four-day visit, is being led by Senior Captain Sun Bo and includes a Chinese resupply ship, the Qiandaohu, the Global New Light of Myanmar newspaper reported.翻译:据缅甸《全球新光报》报道，这支700人的部队由孙波大尉率领，包括一艘中国补给船“千岛湖”号，正在进行为期四天的访问。

The Chinese task force would "conduct naval security exercises" with Myanmar, it reported.翻译:据报道，中国特遣部队将与缅甸“进行海军安全演习”。

The Chinese vessels are part of the Chinese navy's 44th fleet that has conducted anti-piracy operations in the Gulf of Aden and off the coast of Somalia since 2008. The 44th fleet was sighted in the United Arab Emirates this month.翻译:这些中国船只是中国海军第44批编队的一部分，自2008年以来，该编队一直在亚丁湾和索马里沿岸执行反海盗行动。本月，第44批编队在阿拉伯联合酋长国被发现。

China's military has stepped up defence engagement in Southeast Asia this year after the lifting of zero-COVID restrictions in late 2022.翻译:自 2022 年底取消零新冠病毒限制后，中国军队今年加强了在东南亚的防务活动。

This month, the Chinese and Vietnamese navies conducted their 35th joint patrol in Beibu Gulf since 2005, while Chinese troops held a border defence exchange with armed forces from Laos.翻译:本月，中越海军在北部湾进行了自2005年以来第35次联合巡逻，中国军队与老挝武装部队举行边防交流。

The Chinese naval visit comes as Myanmar junta forces are battling ethnic minority insurgents near the border with China, raising concerns in China, which has called for peace.翻译:中国海军此次访问正值缅甸军政府军队在与中国边境附近与少数民族叛乱分子作战之际，这引起了呼吁和平的中国的担忧。

Chinese troops have been conducting live-fire drills on their side of the border since Saturday so that People's Liberation Army (PLA) forces are "ready for any emergency", the PLA Daily reported.翻译:据《解放军报》报道，自周六以来，中国军队一直在边境一侧进行实弹演习，以便中国人民解放军“做好应对任何紧急情况的准备”。

The drills, due to end on Tuesday, are in line with an annual training plan but the PLA Daily said the conflict in Myanmar had inflicted casualties and was "complicating the security situation".翻译:演习将于周二结束，符合年度训练计划，但《解放军报》表示，缅甸冲突造成人员伤亡，并使“安全局势复杂化”。

Reporting by Albee Zhang and Ryan Woo; editing by Robert Birsel翻译:Albee 张和 Ryan Woo 的报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔编辑

item.title: 罗素：疲软的中国和印度可能会破坏金价上涨的希望
item.description:
The spot price of gold has climbed to a six-month high, buoyed by hopes that monetary tightening in western countries is largely done and dusted.翻译:由于西方国家的货币紧缩政策已基本完成并尘埃落定，黄金现货价格已攀升至六个月高位。

While signs that the U.S. Federal Reserve and other western central banks have finished increasing interest rates are a definite positive for the precious metal, they're not the only factor.翻译:虽然美联储和其他西方央行已经完成加息的迹象对贵金属来说无疑是利好，但它们并不是唯一的因素。

China and India make up more than 50% of the physical gold market, giving the two Asian heavyweights a major influence on the likely price trajectory.翻译:中国和印度占实物黄金市场的 50% 以上，这使得这两个亚洲重量级国家对可能的价格走势产生重大影响。

In local currency terms gold is close to record highs in both China and India, and there are signs that this may be starting to impact on retail demand in both countries.翻译:以当地货币计算，中国和印度的黄金价格均接近历史高位，有迹象表明这可能开始影响两国的零售需求。

Spot gold reached a six-month high of $2,017.82 an ounce on Monday and is up 11.5% since the recent low of $1,809.50 on Oct. 6.翻译:现货黄金周一触及六个月高位2017.82美元/盎司，较10月6日触及近期低点1809.50美元上涨11.5%。

In Indian rupees, gold reached 168,145 rupees an ounce on Monday, close to its all-time high of 169,401 rupees from May 4. It has gained 11.8% since the recent low on Oct. 6 of 150,401 rupees.翻译:以印度卢比计算，周一金价达到每盎司168,145卢比，接近5月4日以来的历史高点169,401卢比。自10月6日的近期低点150,401卢比以来，金价已上涨11.8%。

While India's gold demand has been solid so far in 2023, matching strength in the domestic economy, it appears that some momentum may be coming out of the market.翻译:尽管 2023 年迄今为止，印度的黄金需求一直强劲，与国内经济实力相匹配，但市场似乎可能正在释放一些动力。

The discounts offered by dealers off official domestic prices, inclusive of 15% import and 3% sales levies, doubled to $6 an ounce last week amid reports of lacklustre demand for the upcoming wedding season.翻译:由于有报道称即将到来的婚礼季节需求低迷，上周经销商根据国内官方价格提供的折扣（包括 15% 的进口税和 3% 的销售税）翻了一番，达到每盎司 6 美元。

It's a similar story in China, with the premium over spot prices declining to $20 to $40 an ounce last week from the $43 to $58 previously.翻译:中国的情况也类似，上周现货价格溢价从之前的每盎司 43 美元至 58 美元降至 20 美元至 40 美元。

Another proxy for China's demand is its imports from Hong Kong, which fell for a second consecutive month in October.翻译:中国需求的另一个指标是来自香港的进口，十月份连续第二个月下降。

China's net imports from Hong Kong slid 23% to 26.793 metric tons in October, compared with 34.757 tons in September, data from the Hong Kong Census and Statistics Department showed.翻译:香港政府统计处的数据显示，10 月份中国从香港的净进口量下降 23%，至 26.793 吨，而 9 月份为 34.757 吨。

Higher prices and lingering economic uncertainty in the world's largest gold consumer are the most likely reasons for the muted import demand.翻译:全球最大黄金消费国的价格上涨和挥之不去的经济不确定性是进口需求疲软的最可能原因。

Spot gold in China's currency reached 14,433 yuan an ounce on Monday, closing in on the record high of 14,701 yuan from Oct. 27. The price is now 15.7% higher than the 2023 low of 12,479 yuan, hit in mid-February.翻译:以人民币计价的现货黄金周一触及每盎司14,433元，收盘于10月27日以来的历史新高14,701元。目前该价格较2月中旬触及的2023年低点12,479元上涨15.7%。

The high price of gold for consumers in China may further crimp demand in the fourth quarter, after the World Gold Council reported a decline in third.翻译:在世界黄金协会报告第三季度金价下跌后，中国消费者的高金价可能会进一步抑制第四季度的需求。

China's jewellery demand was 153.7 metric tons in the third quarter, down 6% from the 163.2 in the same quarter last year, the council said in its latest Gold Demand Trends report.翻译:该委员会在最新的黄金需求趋势报告中表示，第三季度中国金饰需求量为153.7吨，较去年同期的163.2吨下降6%。

The council's view is that this was actually quite a strong performance, pointing to the fact that in yuan terms, the third quarter was a record high.翻译:该委员会认为，这实际上是相当强劲的表现，并指出以人民币计算，第三季度创下了历史新高。

However, whether China's consumers are prepared to continue buying gold in the face of high prices is the major question, and the lower imports from Hong Kong and the declining premiums suggest an increasing reluctance.

TWO OF THREE DRIVERS POSITIVE

The same is true for India, which also saw reasonable jewellery demand in the third quarter, with the council reporting a 7% increase to 155.7 metric tons from 146.2 in the same period in 2022.翻译:印度也是如此，该国第三季度的珠宝需求也较为合理，该委员会报告称，印度的珠宝需求量从 2022 年同期的 146.2 吨增长了 7%，达到 155.7 吨。

But it's worth noting that the third quarter gain came amid a slump in domestic prices, which were in a downtrend from May to early October.翻译:但值得注意的是，第三季度的增长是在国内价格暴跌的情况下发生的，从5月到10月初，国内价格一直处于下降趋势。

The recent price rally is likely to trim demand growth in India in the current quarter.翻译:最近的价格上涨可能会削弱印度本季度的需求增长。

Overall, gold tends to rally on a sustained basis when the three major drivers of demand are working in unison.翻译:总体而言，当三大需求驱动因素同时发挥作用时，黄金往往会持续上涨。

These are investment buying, typified by rising holdings in gold exchange-traded funds (ETFs), central bank buying, and finally jewellery and bar and coin purchases.翻译:这些是投资购买，以黄金交易所交易基金（ETF）持有量增加为代表，央行购买，最后是珠宝、金条和金币购买。

Flows into ETFs have risen in recent weeks, although they are still well off the highs in 2023.翻译:最近几周，流入 ETF 的资金有所增加，但仍远低于 2023 年的高点。

Central bank buying was robust in the third quarter, with 337 metric tons reported by the council, the second-strongest third quarter on record.翻译:央行第三季度购买量强劲，理事会报告称购买量为 337 吨，是有记录以来第三季度第二强劲的购买量。

But countering the positive drivers are signs that high prices are undermining demand growth in the key markets of China and India.翻译:但有迹象表明，高价格正在削弱中国和印度主要市场的需求增长，这与积极的推动因素相悖。

This doesn't mean gold can't make further gains, but it may not be as certain a bet as suggested by the likely end of monetary tightening in western economies.翻译:这并不意味着金价无法进一步上涨，但它可能不像西方经济体货币紧缩可能结束所暗示的那样确定。

The opinions expressed here are those of the author, a columnist for Reuters.翻译:本文表达的观点是作者（路透社的专栏作家）的观点。

Editing by Sonali Paul翻译:索纳利·保罗编辑

item.title: 放缓的中国仍引领大宗商品竞争
item.description:
President Xi Jinping is trying to wean China off its property-based, debt-fuelled economic model. The transformation will cool growth in the world’s second-largest economy after years of rapid development. Investors are worried but risk ignoring the structural changes underpinning the country's continuing voracious appetite for raw materials.翻译:中国国家主席习近平正试图让中国摆脱以房地产为基础、债务驱动的经济模式。这一转型将给这个世界第二大经济体在经历了多年的快速发展后的增长降温。投资者感到担忧，但有可能忽视支撑该国对原材料持续旺盛需求的结构性变化。

Take the $300 billion copper market. China imports over 60% of the metal’s globally traded volume. "When it comes to copper, the thinking usually goes that copper equals property, property equals China," said one commodities trader. "And because China property is down, copper must be down too."翻译:以价值 3000 亿美元的铜市场为例。中国进口的金属占全球金属交易量的60%以上。 “谈到铜，人们通常认为铜等于财产，财产等于中国，”一位大宗商品交易员表示。 “由于中国房地产价格下跌，铜价也必然下跌。”

True, the country's vast real estate sector, which powers a quarter of GDP and some 40 other sectors from construction to home appliances, is still finding a bottom. New construction starts by area have shrunk by another 23% in the year to October from an already battered 2022. Coupled with Beijing's geopolitical fissures with the West, ranging from a technology race with Washington to its cosiness with Moscow and its position on Taiwan, investors are having cold feet about a broad set of Chinese assets. China recorded its first-ever quarterly deficit in foreign direct investment – $11.8 billion between July and September.翻译:诚然，中国庞大的房地产行业仍在探底，该行业为国内生产总值的四分之一以及从建筑到家电等约 40 个其他行业提供动力。与已经遭受重创的 2022 年相比，截至 10 月的一年内新开工面积又减少了 23%。再加上北京与西方的地缘政治裂痕，从与华盛顿的技术竞赛到与莫斯科的友好关系以及对台湾的立场，投资者对广泛的中国资产表现出临阵退缩的态度。 7月至9月，中国首次出现季度外国直接投资赤字——118亿美元。

But two nuanced trends complicate the picture. First, as much as Xi frets about housing bubbles, he is still keen to prevent social unrest, given that ordinary Chinese store 70% of their wealth in property. That's why he wants to ensure distressed developers like China Evergrande (3333.HK) finish building the apartments that they have pre-sold to mortgage payers. By October, China still had about 8.2 billion square metres under construction – roughly 80 million typical three-bedroom homes. Copper tends to be used in a building’s late stages, so the potential demand loss arising from the property crisis is likely to be less severe than for iron ore, which is used more prominently at the start of construction.翻译:但两个微妙的趋势使情况变得复杂。首先，尽管习近平对房地产泡沫感到担忧，但他仍然热衷于防止社会动荡，因为普通中国人将其 70% 的财富储存在房地产中。这就是为什么他希望确保中国恒大（3333.HK）等陷入困境的开发商完成预售给抵押贷款付款人的公寓的建设。截至10月，中国仍有约82亿平方米的在建面积——约8000万套典型的三居室住宅。铜往往在建筑的后期使用，因此房地产危机造成的潜在需求损失可能没有铁矿石那么严重，铁矿石在施工初期使用更为突出。

Second, Xi's mission to shift the country's economic drivers from real estate to green and high-tech industries is accelerating. When China’s top leaders set priorities at the Communist Party’s twice-a-decade finance conference on Oct. 31, they explicitly asked that more financial resources go into these investments. That means state-owned banks will probably be guided to lend more to electric cars, wind and solar energy, artificial intelligence and advanced chips. Those industries need copper and other metals.翻译:其次，习近平将国家经济驱动力从房地产转向绿色和高科技产业的使命正在加速推进。当中国最高领导人在 10 月 31 日召开的中国共产党十年两次的金融会议上确定优先事项时，他们明确要求将更多的财政资源投入到这些投资中。这意味着国有银行可能会被引导向电动汽车、风能和太阳能、人工智能和先进芯片提供更多贷款。这些行业需要铜和其他金属。

Thus, while the share of China's “new economy” remains small versus the old growth engines, its rise is also creating new demand for commodities. Copper, for one, is essential in making electric motors and batteries, as well as in power grids, and other efforts to boost renewable energy. In wind energy, for example, China added more generation capacity in the past two years than over the previous seven and will grow its grid-connected wind power at a 10-year compound annual growth rate of 11% to 2.38 terawatts at the end of 2032, according to Wood Mackenzie.翻译:因此，虽然与旧的增长引擎相比，中国“新经济”的份额仍然较小，但其崛起也创造了对大宗商品的新需求。例如，铜对于制造电动机和电池、电网以及其他促进可再生能源的努力至关重要。以风能为例，中国过去两年新增发电量超过前七年，并网风电将以11%的年复合增长率增长，到年底将达到2.38太瓦。根据伍德·麦肯齐的说法，2032 年。

That’s why China's copper demand will still rise by 4 million metric tons from the 2020 level to around 18 million tons per year in 2030, according to estimates by commodity trading group Trafigura. That compares to an increase of 5 million tons in annual demand from 2010 to 2020. And China's copper demand has grown by 8% this year, faster than the 5% Xi is targeting for overall GDP growth. Copper prices followed the boom and gloom surrounding China's pandemic reopening this year, yet they did much better than the collapse threatened by the property downturn. The most traded copper contract on the Shanghai Futures Exchange (SHFE) still rose about 4% this year to $9,367 a ton, while three-month copper contracts on the London Metal Exchange are about 3% higher. Chinese producers are having a blast: shares in Shanghai-listed Zijin Mining (601899.SS) have gained almost 20% this year.翻译:因此，据大宗商品贸易集团托克估计，到2030年，中国的铜需求仍将比2020年的水平增加400万吨，达到每年1800万吨左右。相比之下，从2010年到2020年，年需求量增加了500万吨。今年中国的铜需求增长了8%，高于习近平设定的GDP总体增长5%的目标。铜价跟随今年中国疫情重新爆发的繁荣和低迷，但其表现比房地产低迷威胁的崩溃要好得多。上海期货交易所 (SHFE) 交易量最大的铜合约今年仍上涨约 4%，至每吨 9,367 美元，而伦敦金属交易所的三个月期铜合约上涨约 3%。中国生产商正大放异彩：在上海上市的紫金矿业(601899.SS)股价今年已上涨近 20%。

It’s similar for aluminium, which is prominent in property construction but also in EV components, such as those that enclose and protect the battery pack, and infrastructure like charging stations. China's annual aluminium demand rose by 18 million tons from 2010 to 2020 and is forecast to grow by another 13 million tons to over 50 million tons a year in 2030, per Trafigura. Aluminium prices on the SHFE have risen by more than 1% this year, outperforming global prices on the London Metal Exchange, which have slumped by more than 8%, per ING analysts.翻译:铝的情况与此类似，铝在房地产建筑中占据着重要地位，但在电动汽车组件中也很常见，例如封装和保护电池组的组件以及充电站等基础设施。托克表示，从2010年到2020年，中国的铝需求量每年增加1800万吨，预计到2030年将再增加1300万吨，达到5000万吨以上。 ING 分析师表示，今年上海期货交易所的铝价上涨了 1% 以上，跑赢了伦敦金属交易所的全球铝价，而伦敦金属交易所的铝价已下跌了 8% 以上。

Together, these factors are acting as a floor for Chinese growth. This month, the International Monetary Fund upgraded China's GDP growth for 2023 and 2024. It now expects the country’s output to expand by 4.6% in 2024 from a 4.2% estimate in October. The People’s Republic contributed 35% of world GDP growth in 2019; it would still account for 27% of that in 2024, even if it expands by a sub-par 4%, according to Breakingviews calculations based on IMF and World Bank data. That's partly because other regions, like the United States, are expected to slow.翻译:这些因素共同构成了中国经济增长的基础。本月，国际货币基金组织上调了中国2023年和2024年的GDP增速。目前预计中国2024年的产出将从10月份的4.2%增长4.6%。 2019年，中华人民共和国对世界GDP增长的贡献率为35%；根据 Breakingviews 基于国际货币基金组织和世界银行数据的计算，即使增幅低于 4%，2024 年仍将占其中的 27%。部分原因是美国等其他地区的经济增长预计会放缓。

To be sure, the phasing out of real estate would hit some commodities more than others. For example, China's steel-reliant construction sector may grow at around just 2.5% a year over the next 10 years, per Oxford Economics analysts, which should concern iron ore exporters like Australia. But even then, the blow to prices might be far from extreme. China accounts for nearly 70% of global demand for iron ore so when its housing market slumped in 2015, prices plunged to an all-time low of around $40 per ton. This year, though, they still averaged above $110 per ton, according to HSBC analysts, and are now around the highest in six months. That’s partly due to hopes Beijing will spend money to stimulate the economy, and partly because new demand for steel used in electric vehicles, wind farms, and other infrastructure helped soften the blow.翻译:可以肯定的是，房地产的逐步退出对某些大宗商品的打击会比其他大宗商品更大。例如，根据牛津经济研究院分析师的说法，中国依赖钢铁的建筑行业未来 10 年的年增长率可能仅为 2.5% 左右，这应该引起澳大利亚等铁矿石出口国的担忧。但即便如此，对价格的打击可能还远非极端。中国占全球铁矿石需求的近70%，因此当2015年中国房地产市场低迷时，铁矿石价格跌至每吨40美元左右的历史低点。不过，据汇丰银行分析师称，今年的平均价格仍高于每吨 110 美元，目前约为六个月来的最高水平。部分原因是希望北京方面花钱刺激经济，部分原因是电动汽车、风电场和其他基础设施对钢材的新需求有助于缓解冲击。

As China transitions to a new economic model, its appetite for green technologies should continue to benefit Latin American countries like Chile – a top copper producer – and Indonesia, which produces more niche metals such as nickel, as well as African countries like the Democratic Republic of Congo, which dominates cobalt mining.翻译:随着中国向新的经济模式转型，其对绿色技术的兴趣应会继续惠及拉美国家，如最大的铜生产国智利和生产镍等更多利基金属的印度尼西亚，以及民主共和国等非洲国家刚果，主导钴矿开采。

As the Chinese idiom goes, a skinnier camel would still be bigger than a horse. From a commodities perspective, investors who are too focused on China’s loss of economic weight risk overlooking the fact that it remains too big to ignore.翻译:中国有句成语，“骆驼瘦了，马还大”。从大宗商品的角度来看，过于关注中国经济失重风险的投资者忽视了中国经济规模仍然大得不容忽视的事实。

item.title: 中国的Shein如何成为快时尚巨头
item.description:
China-founded fashion company Shein has confidentially filed to go public in the United States, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.翻译:两位知情人士周一告诉路透社，中国创立的时尚公司 Shein 已秘密申请在美国上市。

Here are some key facts:

WHO IS SHEIN?

Founded by Chinese entrepreneur Chris Xu in 2012, Shein has since grown into a global fashion marketplace, serving customers in more than 150 countries and employing with more than 11,000 people, according to its website.翻译:据其网站称，Shein 由中国企业家 Chris Xu 于 2012 年创立，现已发展成为一个全球时尚市场，为 150 多个国家的客户提供服务，拥有超过 11,000 名员工。

Churning out thousands of new designs a day, Shein has a direct-selling model that targets its millions of social-media followers and makes heavy use of influencers and discount codes.翻译:Shein 每天推出数千种新设计，其直销模式针对数百万社交媒体粉丝，并大量利用影响者和折扣代码。

Shein, known for its $10 tops and $5 biker shorts, says it has more than 250 million followers on social media, and a portfolio of 10 brands including Romwe, MOTF and Cuccoo.翻译:Shein 以 10 美元的上衣和 5 美元的机车短裤而闻名，该公司表示，该公司在社交媒体上拥有超过 2.5 亿粉丝，旗下拥有 Romwe、MOTF 和 Cuccoo 等 10 个品牌。

It does not disclose its revenue publicly but sources say the company made around 100 billion yuan ($15.7 billion) in 2021.

BUSINESS MODEL

Shein produces clothing in China to sell online in the United States, Europe and Asia excluding China.翻译:Shein 在中国生产服装，并在​​美国、欧洲和亚洲（中国除外）进行网上销售。

It does not own or operate any manufacturing facilities and instead works with around 5,400 third-party contract manufacturers, mainly in China.翻译:它不拥有或经营任何制造设施，而是与大约 5,400 家第三方合约制造商合作，其中主要位于中国。

It uses an on-demand manufacturing system that allows it to quickly boost production of popular items and drop products that do not sell as expected. The process helps improve production speed and inventory management.翻译:它使用按需制造系统，使其能够快速提高受欢迎商品的产量，并放弃销售不按预期的产品。该流程有助于提高生产速度和库存管理。

Shein says the approach has helped it consistently achieve average unsold inventory rates in the low single digits.

U.S. SCRUTINY

Shein ships the majority of its products directly from China to shoppers by air in individually addressed packages.翻译:Shein 的大部分产品采用独立地址包装，通过空运直接从中国运送给购物者。

Its strategy helped the firm avoid unsold inventory piling up in warehouses and avoid import tax in the United States, one of its biggest markets, as it allows the e-tailer to take advantage of the "de minimis" provision that exempts cheap products from tariffs.翻译:其战略帮助该公司避免了未售出的库存堆积在仓库中，并避免了其最大市场之一美国的进口税，因为它允许电子零售商利用“最低限度”条款，使廉价产品免征关税。

The tax provision is now under growing congressional scrutiny, with critics saying it allowing the companies to evade higher tariffs on Chinese goods.翻译:该税收条款目前正受到国会越来越严格的审查，批评人士称，该条款允许这些公司逃避对中国商品征收的更高关税。

The decades-old tariff exemption for packages valued at $800 or less is open to all retailers but is most heavily used by Chinese firms including Shein, PDD Holding's (PDD.O) Temu and potentially by TikTok's new e-commerce business.翻译:已有数十年历史的针对价值 800 美元或以下包裹的关税豁免政策向所有零售商开放，但最常使用的是中国公司，包括 Shein、拼多多控股(PDD.O) Temu，也可能是 TikTok 的新电子商务业务。

Its online only sales strategy has helped it keep overheads down, but growing wait times - up of two weeks or more to receive goods in the U.S. - has put it at a disadvantage against rivals such as Target (TGT.N), Walmart (WMT.N) and Amazon.com (AMZN.O).翻译:其仅在线销售策略帮助其降低了管理费用，但不断增长的等待时间（在美国接收货物需要两周或更长时间）使其在与 Target (TGT.N) 、沃尔玛(WMT ) 等竞争对手相比时处于劣势.N)和 Amazon.com (AMZN.O) 。

It is now sending more low-priced apparel and home goods to U.S. warehouses to speed up shipping times, according to trade analysis firm ImportGenius.

VALUATION

The company was valued at more than $60 billion in a $2 billion private fundraising round in March, making it bigger than Swedish retailer H&M (HMb.ST) which is worth $27 billion.翻译:该公司在 3 月份的一轮 20 亿美元私募融资中估值超过 600 亿美元，超过瑞典零售商 H&M (HMb.ST)的估值 270 亿美元。

At that valuation, Shein would still trail Uniqlo owner Fast Retailing's (9983.T) $80 billion valuation and Zara owner Inditex's (ITX.MC) $126 billion.翻译:按照这一估值，Shein 仍落后于优衣库所有者迅销集团 (Fast Retailing ) (9983.T) 的800 亿美元估值和 Zara 所有者 Inditex (ITX.MC)的 1,260 亿美元估值。

Shein moved its headquarters to Singapore from Nanjing, capital of China's eastern Jiangsu province, around late 2021, a shift that analysts said helps the firm circumvent China's tough new rules on overseas listings.翻译:Shein 于 2021 年底左右将总部从中国东部江苏省省会南京迁至新加坡，分析师表示，这一转变有助于该公司规避中国对海外上市的严格新规定。

Reporting by Miyoung Kim; Editing by Stephen Coates翻译:Miyoung Kim 报道；斯蒂芬·科茨编辑

item.title: Lotus Tech 在与 L Catterton SPAC 交易完成之前获得 8.7 亿美元融资
item.description:
Lotus Technology, the luxury electric vehicle arm of sports car brand Lotus, said on Tuesday it has secured $870 million in financing ahead of the completion of its merger with blank check company L Catterton Asia Acquisition (LCAA) (LCAA.O).翻译:跑车品牌莲花旗下的豪华电动汽车子公司莲花科技 (Lotus Technology) 周二表示，在完成与空白支票公司 L Catterton Asia Acquisition (LCAA) (LCAA.O)的合并之前，该公司已获得 8.7 亿美元融资。

All of the financing was secured based on a $5.5 billion valuation, China-headquartered Lotus Technology said in a statement.翻译:总部位于中国的莲花科技在一份声明中表示，所有融资均以 55 亿美元的估值获得。

Investors will be issued public shares upon closing of the business combination with LCAA, and result in Lotus Technology having a free float of over 19%, excluding existing LCAA shareholders, it said.翻译:莲花科技表示，在与 LCAA 的业务合并完成后，投资者将发行公众股，届时莲花科技的自由流通量将超过 19%（不包括现有的 LCAA 股东）。

The funds will be used to further advance development of "next-generation automobility technologies, promote product innovation, support the company's expansion of its global distribution network, and for general corporate purposes", the statement showed.翻译:声明显示，这些资金将用于进一步推进“下一代汽车技术的开发，促进产品创新，支持公司扩大其全球分销网络，并用于一般企业用途”。

Lotus Technology in January said it will go public in the United States by merging with LCAA, a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) formed by affiliates of L Catterton, an investment firm backed by luxury goods empire LVMH Louis Vuitton Moet Hennessy (LVMH.PA).翻译:莲花科技 (Lotus Technology) 一月份表示，将通过与 LCAA 合并在美国上市，LCAA 是一家特殊目的收购公司 (SPAC)，由奢侈品帝国 LVMH 路易威登酩悦轩尼诗(LVMH.PA ) 支持的投资公司 L Catterton 的附属公司组建。 ） 。

Lotus Technology is part of British sports car maker Lotus Group which is in turn owned jointly by Chinese automaker Geely (GEELY.UL) and Malaysia's Etika Automotive.翻译:莲花科技是英国跑车制造商莲花集团的一部分，而莲花集团又由中国汽车制造商吉利 (GEELY.UL) 和马来西亚 Etika Automotive 共同拥有。

item.title: 交易员等待通胀数据，亚洲股市小幅上涨
item.description:
Asian stocks edged higher on Tuesday, while the dollar was at its lowest in three months as investors remained convinced the Federal Reserve was done with its rate-hike cycle and looked ahead to a crucial inflation report later this week.翻译:亚洲股市周二小幅走高，而美元跌至三个月来的最低点，因为投资者仍然相信美联储已经完成加息周期，并期待本周晚些时候发布的重要通胀报告。

MSCI's broadest index of Asia-Pacific shares outside Japan (.MIAPJ0000PUS) was 0.39% higher and set for a near 7% gain in November, its strongest monthly performance since January.翻译:MSCI 日本以外最广泛的亚太股市指数(.MIAPJ0000PUS)上涨 0.39%，11 月份涨幅接近 7%，这是自 1 月份以来最强劲的月度表现。

Japan's Nikkei (.N225) eased 0.20% but is up 8% this month, on course for its strongest monthly performance in three years.翻译:日本日经指数(.N225)下跌 0.20%，但本月上涨 8%，有望创下三年来最强劲的月度表现。

"The outlook for central bank policy has been a big factor driving the improvement in risk appetite in November," said Rodrigo Catril, senior FX strategist at National Australia Bank.翻译:澳大利亚国民银行高级外汇策略师Rodrigo Catril表示，“央行政策前景是推动11月份风险偏好改善的一个重要因素。”

The evidence of an easing inflationary pressures has supported the view that many central banks are done with their tightening cycles and rate cut expectations for next year have been brought forward, Catril said.翻译:卡特里尔表示，通胀压力缓解的证据支持了这样的观点，即许多央行已经结束了紧缩周期，明年的降息预期已经提前。

Markets are pricing in a 96.8% likelihood that the U.S. central bank will leave interest rates unchanged next month, with the possibility of a rate cut starting to gain ground in mid-2024, according to CME's FedWatch tool.翻译:根据 CME 的 FedWatch 工具，市场预计美联储下个月维持利率不变的可能性为 96.8%，降息的可能性在 2024 年中期开始增加。

Investors will focus this week on the Fed's preferred measure of inflation on Thursday and euro zone consumer inflation figures for further clarity on the where inflation is headed.翻译:投资者本周将关注周四美联储首选的通胀指标和欧元区消费者通胀数据，以进一步明确通胀的走向。

European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said on Monday the central bank's fight to contain price growth is not yet done, citing a still strong wage growth and an uncertain outlook even as inflation pressures in euro zone ease.翻译:欧洲央行行长拉加德周一表示，央行遏制物价增长的斗争尚未结束，理由是尽管欧元区通胀压力有所缓解，工资增长依然强劲，且前景不确定。

Fed Chair Jerome Powell is also due to speak on Friday his words will be scrutinized by traders to gauge where rates may head.翻译:美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔也将于周五发表讲话，交易员将仔细审查他的言论，以判断利率可能走向。

China's blue-chip CSI 300 Index (.CSI300) was 0.23% lower while Hong Kong's Hang Seng index (.HSI) fell 0.70%, a day after data showed profit at China's industrial firms grew at a slower pace in October.翻译:中国蓝筹股沪深 300 指数(.CSI300)下跌 0.23%，香港恒生指数(.HSI)下跌 0.70%，一天前数据显示中国工业企业利润增长放缓。

U.S. data on Monday showed sales of new single-family homes fell more than expected in October, as higher mortgage rates reduced affordability, but the housing segment remains supported by a persistent shortage of existing properties on the market.翻译:周一美国数据显示，由于抵押贷款利率上升降低了负担能力，10 月份新单户住宅销售量下降幅度超过预期，但市场上现有房产持续短缺仍支撑着住房市场。

The weaker-than-expected data weighed on Treasury yields, with the yield on benchmark 10-year notes slipping 9.6 basis points on Monday. In Asian hours, they were up 1.6 basis points at 4.404%.翻译:弱于预期的数据打压了美国国债收益率，基准10年期国债收益率周一下跌9.6个基点。亚洲时段，该指数上涨 1.6 个基点至 4.404%。

The dollar index , a measure of the greenback against a basket of currencies, fell to 103.11, its lowest since Aug. 31. The Japanese yen strengthened 0.28% to 148.25 per dollar.翻译:衡量美元兑一篮子货币的美元指数跌至103.11，为8月31日以来的最低点。日元兑美元汇率上涨0.28%，至148.25。

Oil prices inched higher on Tuesday after a steep fall the previous day as investors awaited this week's OPEC+ meeting and expected curbs on supplies into next year.翻译:油价在前一天大幅下跌后，周二小幅走高，因投资者等待本周的 OPEC+ 会议以及预计明年的供应限制。

U.S. crude was 0.31% higher at $75.09 per barrel and Brent was back above $80.翻译:美国原油上涨 0.31%，至每桶 75.09 美元，布伦特原油重回 80 美元上方。

Spot gold added 0.1% to $2,015.00 an ounce, just shy of the three month high it touched on Monday.翻译:现货黄金上涨 0.1%，至每盎司 2,015.00 美元，略低于周一触及的三个月高点。

item.title: 西方的去风险化举措开始损害中国的前景
item.description:
Summary:
  • China records first quarterly foreign direct investment deficit
  • Execs worry about China slowdown, geopolitics, regulations
  • Trend could weigh on yuan, chip away at growth potential-analyst
  • China-focused buyout fundraising has ground to a halt-data
翻译:概括：
  • 中国首次出现季度外国直接投资赤字
  • 高管担心中国经济放缓、地缘政治和监管
  • 分析师称，趋势可能会对人民币造成压力，削弱增长潜力
  • 以中国为重点的收购融资已陷入停滞数据

U.S. furniture company head Jordan England thinks his firm's Chinese suppliers are among the best in the game, but geopolitics and a slowing economy have pushed him to source more products from Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe and Mexico.翻译:美国家具公司负责人乔丹·英格兰认为，他的公司的中国供应商是业内最好的供应商之一，但地缘政治和经济放缓迫使他从东南亚、东欧和墨西哥采购更多产品。

"I'm looking to move away from it (China)," said England, CEO and co-founder of Florida-based Industry West.翻译:总部位于佛罗里达州的 Industry West 的首席执行官兼联合创始人 England 表示：“我正在寻求离开（中国）。”

"It was always 'China plus one,'" he said, referring to the diversification strategy many businesses began implementing after Washington imposed trade tariffs on Beijing in 2018 to ensure they were not wholly dependent on Chinese suppliers.翻译:“总是‘中国加一’，”他说，指的是2018年华盛顿对北京征收贸易关税后，许多企业开始实施多元化战略，以确保它们不完全依赖中国供应商。

Now "it's like 'plus-10' and then China," he added, with the latter down to providing half of Industry West's products and being trimmed more.翻译:现在“就像‘+10’，然后是中国，”他补充道，后者减少到提供工业西部一半的产品，并进行了更多削减。

Foreign investors have been sour on China for most of this year, but data released over the past month has provided clear evidence of the negative impact de-risking strategies are having on the world's second-largest economy.翻译:今年大部分时间里，外国投资者一直对中国感到不满，但过去一个月发布的数据清楚地证明了去风险策略对世界第二大经济体产生的负面影响。

Activity surveys showed manufacturing unexpectedly contracted in October, while exports accelerated their decline. China recorded its first-ever quarterly deficit in foreign direct investment in July-September, suggesting capital outflow pressure.翻译:活动调查显示，10 月份制造业意外收缩，而出口则加速下滑。中国7-9月外国直接投资首次出现季度逆差，显示资本外流压力。

Nicholas Lardy, senior researcher at the Peterson Institute for International Economics, said in a note the new data imply that foreign firms are not only declining to reinvest earnings, but are selling existing investments and repatriating funds.翻译:彼得森国际经济研究所高级研究员尼古拉斯·拉迪在一份报告中表示，新数据表明外国公司不仅拒绝将收益再投资，而且正在出售现有投资并将资金汇回国内。

This trend could further weaken the yuan and clip China's economic growth potential, he added.翻译:他补充说，这种趋势可能会进一步削弱人民币并削弱中国的经济增长潜力。

"In recent years, the scale, proportion and growth rate of foreign investment absorbed by China have all remained at a relatively high level," He Yadong, a Chinese commerce ministry spokesperson, said in response to a question from Reuters.

LONG-TERM PROSPECTS

Businesses have longstanding worries about geopolitics, tightening regulations and a more favourable playing field for state-owned companies. But for the first time in the four decades since China opened up to foreign investments, executives are now also concerned about long-term growth prospects.翻译:企业界长期以来对地缘政治、监管收紧以及国有企业更有利的竞争环境感到担忧。但自中国向外国投资开放四十年来，高管们首次对长期增长前景表示担忧。

A survey released last week by The Conference Board, a think tank, showed more than two-thirds of the CEOs who responded said China's demand has not returned to pre-COVID levels, with 40% expecting a decrease in capital investments in the country over the next six months and a similar proportion expecting to cut jobs.翻译:智库世界大型企业联合会上周发布的一项调查显示，超过三分之二的受访首席执行官表示，中国的需求尚未恢复到新冠疫情爆发前的水平，其中 40% 的受访者预计中国的资本投资将在未来六个月，预计裁员的比例类似。

China is outwardly confident about growth despite a global economic slowdown, with policy advisers favouring a target of about a 5% expansion of gross domestic product in 2024 and the country aiming to double the economy's size by 2035.翻译:尽管全球经济放缓，但中国表面上对增长充满信心，政策顾问支持2024年国内生产总值增长约5%的目标，并计划到2035年将经济规模扩大一倍。

But England said he is concerned about how his Chinese suppliers that also produce for the domestic market will cope with the country's severe property market downturn.翻译:但英格兰表示，他担心同样为国内市场生产的中国供应商将如何应对该国严重的房地产市场低迷。

"I'm worried about these factories going from 500 workers to 200, to 100," he said.

OPEN FOR BUSINESS?

Premier Li Qiang's overtures declaring China open for business to foreign investors after the pandemic have been greeted with scepticism in some Western boardrooms in light of a broader anti-espionage law, raids on consultancies and due diligence firms and exit bans, trade bodies say.翻译:贸易机构表示，鉴于更广泛的反间谍法、对咨询公司和尽职调查公司的突击检查以及出境禁令，疫情后李强总理宣布中国向外国投资者开放的提议遭到了一些西方董事会的怀疑。

Li is expected to make a similar call on Tuesday at the country's inaugural China International Supply Chain Expo, which it is expected to use to tout its supply chain advantages.翻译:预计李克强将于周二在中国首届中国国际供应链博览会上发表类似的讲话，预计中国将利用该博览会宣传其供应链优势。

"Foreign business executives here are eager to continue in China," AmCham President Michael Hart said. "But boards back in the U.S. are wary."翻译:“这里的外国企业高管渴望继续在中国发展，”美国商会主席迈克尔·哈特说。 “但美国的董事会对此持谨慎态度。”

European firms have raised fair competition concerns about state-directed lending to Chinese manufacturers, while Noah Fraser, managing director of the Canada China Business Council, said "bad blood" remains over the detention of two Canadians from 2018 to 2021.翻译:欧洲公司对国家向中国制造商提供的贷款提出了公平竞争担忧，而加中贸易理事会董事总经理诺亚·弗雷泽(Noah Fraser)表示，2018年至2021年两名加拿大人被拘留的问题仍然存在“不和”。

In private equity, while Asia-focused funds have allocated capital to China, data from Preqin shows that as of Nov. 24, no China-focused buyout fund had been raised in 2023 in any currency, compared with $210 million in 2022 and $13.2 billion in 2019, before the pandemic.翻译:在私募股权领域，虽然专注于亚洲的基金已向中国配置资金，但Preqin的数据显示，截至11月24日，2023年没有以任何货币筹集专注于中国的收购基金，而2022年为2.1亿美元，2022年为132亿美元。 2019年，疫情爆发之前。

Primavera Capital founder Fred Hu cites mounting macroeconomic uncertainty, a "murky capital market outlook," and lingering concerns over past regulatory crackdowns on high-growth industries such as technology and education.翻译:春华资本创始人胡祖六表示，宏观经济不确定性不断增加、“资本市场前景黯淡”，以及对过去对科技和教育等高增长行业的监管打压的持续担忧。

"Tech firms and other private enterprises must be able to tap public markets for financing and liquidity, so the current market conditions in China do considerable harm to the real economy," said Hu, adding China-focused private equity firms were diverting capital to Southeast Asia, Australia and Europe.翻译:胡说：“科技公司和其他私营企业必须能够利用公共市场进行融资和流动性，因此中国目前的市场状况对实体经济造成了相当大的损害。”他补充说，专注于中国的私募股权公司正在将资金转移到东南部亚洲、澳大利亚和欧洲。

Despite the challenges, foreign investment flows are not unidirectional. Many firms, especially in the retail sector, still target China's giant market. McDonald's (MCD.N) said last week it had struck a deal to boost its stake in its China business.翻译:尽管面临挑战，外国投资流动并不是单向的。许多公司，尤其是零售行业的公司，仍然瞄准中国这个巨大的市场。麦当劳(MCD.N)上周表示，已达成一项协议，以增持其在中国业务的股份。

An executive at a European hotel chain, who spoke on condition of anonymity due to the topic's sensitivity, said his firm was happy to reinvest profits in China for now.翻译:一位欧洲连锁酒店的高管表示，他的公司目前很乐意将利润再投资到中国。由于该话题的敏感性，该高管要求匿名。

"We know what's going on politically and yes, economically," he said, adding the latest data "was nothing to be proud of."翻译:他说：“我们知道政治上正在发生什么，是的，经济上也发生了什么事。”他补充说，最新数据“没有什么值得骄傲的”。

"It's slow, but only warrants taking a 'wait and see approach.'"翻译:“虽然速度很慢，但只能采取‘观望态度’。”

item.title: 早盘出价：市场波动但希望低波动反弹
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.翻译:展望未来一天的亚洲市场。

Asian markets are lacking firm direction either way, but bulls will be hoping the combination of a weaker dollar, lower U.S. bond yields and softer oil prices on Monday will provide the impetus for a more positive session on Tuesday.翻译:不管怎样，亚洲市场都缺乏坚定的方向，但多头希望周一美元走软、 美国债券收益率下降和油价走软的结合将为周二的交易提供动力。

Volatility across major asset classes is low - implied volatility on Wall Street is at its lowest in almost four years, global currency implied vol is the lowest since early last year, and U.S. bond vol is at a two-month low.翻译:主要资产类别的波动性较低——华尔街的隐含波动性处于近四年来的最低水平，全球货币隐含波动性为去年初以来的最低水平，美国债券波动性处于两个月低点。

There are few signs of market stress. But clear 'buy' signals aren't obvious either - the final trading week of November got off to a listless start, with the MSCI World and Asia ex-Japan indexes drifting 0.2% lower on Monday.翻译:几乎没有迹象表明市场面临压力。但明确的“买入”信号也不明显——11 月最后一个交易周开局无精打采，摩根士丹利资本国际 (MSCI) 世界指数和亚洲（日本除外）指数周一下跌 0.2%。

On aggregate, Asian stocks have under-performed global benchmarks this year. China's markets, especially, have lagged, although Japanese stocks have outperformed thanks to the weak yen and a historic loosening of wider financial conditions.翻译:总体而言，亚洲股市今年的表现落后于全球基准。尽管日本股市因日元疲软和更广泛的金融环境出现历史性宽松而跑赢大盘，但中国市场表现尤其落后。

Financial conditions tightened a bit last week, according to Goldman Sachs calculations, but remain broadly supportive of risk appetite - aggregate emerging market conditions are almost 100 basis points looser than they were a month ago, in large part thanks to lower U.S. yields and a weaker dollar.翻译:根据高盛的计算，金融状况上周略有收紧，但仍普遍支持风险偏好——新兴市场总体状况比一个月前宽松近 100 个基点，这在很大程度上要归功于美国国债收益率下降和经济疲软。美元。

Asia's economic, policy and corporate calendars are light on Tuesday. The main economic indicator will be Australian retail sales for October. Economists expect month-on-month growth to slow sharply to just 0.1% from 0.9% in September.翻译:周二亚洲经济、政策和企业日历清淡。主要经济指标将是澳大利亚十月份的零售销售。经济学家预计环比增长率将从 9 月份的 0.9% 大幅放缓至 0.1%。

The figures will be released just before Reserve Bank of Australia Governor Michele Bullock is scheduled to speak in Hong Kong on a panel jointly hosted by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and Bank for International Settlements.翻译:这些数据将在澳大利亚储备银行行长米歇尔·布洛克计划在香港金融管理局和国际清算银行联合主办的小组会议上发表讲话之前公布。

Bullock is thought to be more hawkish than her predecessor Philip Lowe which, if true, should in theory lend support to the Australian dollar.翻译:人们认为布洛克比她的前任菲利普·洛更为鹰派，如果属实，理论上应该会给澳元带来支撑。

The Aussie on Monday rose above $0.66 for the first time since Aug. 10 and was one of the biggest winners among major currencies along with the Japanese yen and New Zealand dollar.翻译:澳元周一自8月10日以来首次升至0.66美元上方，与日元和新西兰元一起成为主要货币中最大的赢家之一。

It has risen 5% in a month, broadly in line with other G10 currencies' gains against the greenback as traders have moved to price in the end of the U.S. tightening cycle and up to 100 basis points of Fed rate cuts in the second half of next year.翻译:一个月内上涨了 5%，与其他 G10 货币兑美元的涨幅大致一致，因为交易者在美国紧缩周期结束时开始定价，并且下半年美联储降息高达 100 个基点明年。

But unlike all other G10 central banks - the Bank of Japan being the obvious exception - the RBA is not expected to ease policy in 2024. Bullock's remarks on Tuesday could shine a light on how much of an outlier the RBA will ultimately be.翻译:但与所有其他 G10 央行（ 日本央行是明显的例外）不同，预计澳洲联储不会在 2024 年放松政策。布洛克周二的言论可能会让人们了解澳洲联储最终会有多大的异类。

Here are key developments that could provide more direction to markets on Tuesday:翻译:以下是可能为周二市场提供更多方向的关键进展：

- Australia retail sales (October)翻译:- 澳大利亚零售销售（十月）

- RBA Governor Bullock speaks翻译:- 澳洲联储行长布洛克讲话

- Fed's Waller, Bowman, Goolsbee, Barr speak翻译:- 美联储沃勒、鲍曼、古尔斯比、巴尔发言

item.title: 马来西亚MH370客机失踪中国家属向法庭寻求赔偿
item.description:
A Beijing court on Monday began compensation hearings for the Chinese relatives of passengers on board Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, which mysteriously disappeared over the Indian Ocean almost a decade ago, the plaintiffs said.翻译:原告称，北京一家法院周一开始为马来西亚航空公司 MH370 航班乘客的中国亲属举行赔偿听证会，该航班近十年前在印度洋神秘失踪。

Over 150 Chinese passengers were on the flight which vanished en route from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing on March 8, 2014. Malaysian investigators did not rule out the possibility that the aircraft had been deliberately taken off course, and debris confirmed or believed to be from the aircraft has washed up along the coast of Africa and on islands in the Indian Ocean.翻译:2014 年 3 月 8 日，这架航班在从吉隆坡飞往北京的途中失踪，机上载有 150 多名中国乘客。马来西亚调查人员不排除飞机被故意偏离航线的可能性，残骸已确认或相信来自飞机。飞机被冲到非洲海岸和印度洋岛屿上。

Relatives of these passengers said they were demanding compensation from Malaysia Airlines, Boeing, aircraft engine maker Rolls-Royce and Allianz insurance group among others.翻译:这些乘客的亲属表示，他们要求马来西亚航空、波音公司、飞机发动机制造商劳斯莱斯和安联保险集团等提供赔偿。

The court did not release any details on the case, but state media said more than 40 relatives were seeking between 10 million and 80 million yuan ($1.4 million and $11.2 million) each in compensation.翻译:法院没有公布该案的任何细节，但官方媒体称，40 多名亲属正在寻求每人 1000 万至 8000 万元人民币（140 万美元至 1120 万美元）的赔偿。

Malaysia Airlines, Rolls-Royce, Allianz and Boeing did not immediately respond to requests for comment.翻译:马来西亚航空、劳斯莱斯、安联和波音没有立即回应置评请求。

Holding up signs saying "resume the search" and "re-establish an international investigation team", Jiang Hui, a spokesperson for the bereaved families, said Malaysia Airlines left them with no choice but to go to court to seek answers.翻译:遇难者家属发言人江辉举着“恢复搜寻”和“重新成立国际调查组”的牌子，表示马航让他们别无选择，只能上法庭寻求答案。

"'We are not responsible anymore' is their attitude," said Jiang, whose mother was on board.翻译:“‘我们不再负责’是他们的态度，”蒋的母亲在船上。

There was a heavy police presence outside Chaoyang District People's Court in Beijing before the hearing, with reporters cordoned off and unable to interact with the family members.翻译:开庭前，北京朝阳区人民法院外戒备森严，记者被封锁，无法与家属互动。

Some of the relatives, who spoke to reporters after the hearing, said they wanted the resumption of search efforts and for Malaysia Airlines to directly communicate with them as well as to provide them with psychological counselling.翻译:一些在听证会后接受记者采访的亲属表示，他们希望恢复搜寻工作，并希望马航能够直接与他们沟通，并为他们提供心理咨询。

Many said these demands were more important than the monetary compensation.翻译:许多人表示，这些要求比金钱补偿更重要。

"My mother died last year and she brought up my son. Until the very end I hid from her what really happened to him," said Beijing resident Bao Lanfang, 71, who lost her son and daughter-in-law on board. She said her husband had recently died after suffering from severe depression because of the incident.翻译:“我的母亲去年去世了，她抚养了我的儿子。直到最后我才向她隐瞒了他的真实情况，”71岁的北京居民鲍兰芳说，她在船上失去了儿子和儿媳。她说，她的丈夫因这起事件而患上严重抑郁症，最近去世了。

In March, another group of relatives urged the Malaysian government to allow U.S. seabed exploration firm Ocean Infinity to mount a new search for the missing plane.翻译:今年三月，另一群亲属敦促马来西亚政府允许美国海底勘探公司 Ocean Infinity 对失踪飞机进行新的搜索。

Reporting by Laurie Chen; editing by Miral Fahmy翻译:陈劳瑞报道；米拉尔·法赫米 编辑

item.title: 世界卫生组织官员：中国呼吸系统疾病的激增程度没有大流行前那么高
item.description:
The spike in respiratory illnesses that China is currently suffering is not as high as before the COVID-19 pandemic, a World Health Organisation official said, reiterating that no new or unusual pathogens had been found in the recent cases.翻译:世界卫生组织官员表示，中国目前呼吸道疾病的激增程度没有 COVID-19 大流行之前那么高，并重申在最近的病例中没有发现新的或不寻常的病原体。

Maria Van Kerkhove, acting director of the WHO's department of epidemic and pandemic preparedness and prevention, said the increase appeared to be driven by a rise in the number of children contracting pathogens that they had avoided during two years of COVID restrictions.翻译:世界卫生组织流行病和大流行防备与预防部门代理主任玛丽亚·范·克霍夫表示，这一增长似乎是由于感染病原体的儿童数量增加所致，而他们在两年的新冠病毒限制期间避免了感染病原体。

"We asked about comparisons prior to the pandemic. And the waves that they’re seeing now, the peak is not as high as what they saw in 2018-2019," Van Kerkhove told health news outlet STAT in an interview on Friday.翻译:“我们询问了大流行之前的比较。他们现在看到的浪潮，峰值并不像他们在 2018-2019 年看到的那么高，”Van Kerkhove 在周五接受健康新闻媒体 STAT 采访时表示。

"This is not an indication of a novel pathogen. This is expected. This is what most countries dealt with a year or two ago," she added.翻译:“这并不是新病原体的迹象。这是预料之中的。这是大多数国家一两年前处理过的问题，”她补充道。

China's National Health Commission spokesperson Mi Feng said on Sunday the surge in acute respiratory illnesses was linked to the simultaneous circulation of several kinds of pathogens, most prominently influenza.翻译:中国国家卫生健康委员会发言人米锋周日表示，急性呼吸道疾病的激增与多种病原体的同时传播有关，其中最突出的是流感。

The spike became a global issue last week when the World Health Organization asked China for more information, citing a report on clusters of undiagnosed pneumonia in children by the Program for Monitoring Emerging Diseases.翻译:上周，世界卫生组织引用新发疾病监测计划关于儿童未确诊肺炎群的报告， 要求中国提供更多信息，从而使病例激增成为一个全球性问题。

China and the WHO have faced questions about the transparency of reporting early in the pandemic, which emerged in the central Chinese city of Wuhan in late 2019. The WHO said on Friday no new or unusual pathogens had been found in the recent illnesses.翻译:中国和世界卫生组织在 2019 年底在中国中部城市武汉爆发的疫情早期报告透明度方面面临质疑。世界卫生组织周五表示，在最近的疾病中没有发现新的或不寻常的病原体。

Health officials urged local authorities on Sunday to increase the number of fever clinics, as hospitals are warning of long waits in northern areas like Beijing and Liaoning province where cases among children appear to be especially high.翻译:卫生官员周日敦促地方当局增加发热门诊的数量，因为医院警告说，在北京和辽宁省等北方地区，儿童病例似乎特别多，等待时间可能会很长。

Spread by young adults in the workplace and children at school, new cases of respiratory illnesses could peak in the next couple of weeks, Li Tongzeng, the chief physician at the infectious diseases department at Beijing You'an Hospital told the Global Times newspaper.翻译:北京佑安医院传染病科主任医师李同增告诉《环球时报》，呼吸道疾病的新增病例可能会在未来几周内达到高峰，由工作场所的年轻人和学校的儿童传播。

In the report published on Monday, Li also warned of the potential for a second wave peaking during the New Year holidays, as the elderly could become more at risk of infection during family gatherings.翻译:在周一发布的报告中，李还警告称，新年假期期间可能会出现第二波高峰，因为老年人在家庭聚会期间可能更容易受到感染。

Reporting by Andrew Silver; Editing by Miyoung Kim, Miral Fahmy & Simon Cameron-Moore翻译:安德鲁·西尔弗报道；编辑：Miyoung Kim、Miral Fahmy 和 Simon Cameron-Moore

item.title: 中国央行承诺支持内需
item.description:
China's central bank on Monday said it would fend off systemic risks to the economy and use forceful and targeted monetary policy to better support domestic demand.翻译:中国央行周一表示，将防范经济系统性风险，运用强有力、有针对性的货币政策更好地支持内需。

In its quarterly policy implementation report, the bank laid out the general direction of financial policy and said it would use a variety of monetary tools at its disposal to ensure sufficient liquidity.翻译:在季度政策执行报告中，央行明确了金融政策的总体方向，并表示将运用多种货币工具，确保流动性充足。

"Prudent monetary policy should be precise and forceful, with greater emphasis on cross-cyclical and countercyclical adjustments, enriching the monetary policy toolbox," the bank said.翻译:央行表示，稳健的货币政策要精准有力，更加注重跨周期和逆周期调节，丰富货币政策工具箱。

The bank added it would "further unblock the monetary policy transmission mechanism", enhance the stability of financial support for the real economy and keep prices "reasonably stable".翻译:该行补充称，将“进一步畅通货币政策传导机制”，增强金融支持实体经济的稳定性，保持物价“合理稳定”。

China's economy is gaining momentum, but it faces challenges such as an imbalanced global economic recovery and an unstable foundation for domestic economic recovery, the central bank said.翻译:央行表示，中国经济发展势头良好，但也面临全球经济复苏不平衡、国内经济复苏基础不稳定等挑战。

Beijing has launched a slew of policy measures this year, seeking to shore up a feeble post-pandemic recovery amid a persistent property sector downturn, local government debt risks, slow global growth and geopolitical tensions.翻译:北京今年推出了一系列政策措施，在房地产行业持续低迷、地方政府债务风险、全球经济增长放缓和地缘政治紧张局势的背景下，寻求支撑疫情后微弱的复苏。

The bank said it would guide financial institutions to resolve local debt risks and noted there was urgency for faster economic transformation.翻译:该行表示将引导金融机构化解地方债务风险，并指出加快经济转型的紧迫性。

"Supply and demand dynamics in the property market have greatly changed," the central bank said.翻译:央行表示，“房地产市场供需格局发生较大变化。”

The bank said it would keep the yuan -- which has come under pressure on the foreign exchange market this year -- "basically stable" and strive to foster a sound monetary and financial environment.翻译:央行表示，今年在外汇市场面临压力的情况下，将保持人民币汇率“基本稳定”，努力营造良好的货币金融环境。

It reiterated that it expects to achieve around 5% growth this year.翻译:它重申，预计今年将实现5%左右的增长。

Reporting by Liangping Gao, Kevin Yao, Ella Cao, Ethan Wang and Bernard Orr; Editing by Toby Chopra and Christina Fincher翻译:高亮平、姚凯文、曹艾拉、王伊森和伯纳德·奥尔报道；托比·乔普拉和克里斯蒂娜·芬奇编辑

item.title: 中国表示重视MH370事件的后续行动
item.description:
China values the follow-up to the incident of MH370, a Malaysia Airlines flight that went missing nearly 10 years ago, and hopes all sides maintain close communication and properly handle this issue, the foreign ministry said on Monday.翻译:外交部周一表示，中方重视近十年前马航MH370航班失踪事件的后续进展，希望各方保持密切沟通，妥善处理这一问题。

Spokesperson Wang Wenbin made the comments after a media report of a Chinese court holding the first hearing of a liability lawsuit filed by relatives of passengers on MH370.翻译:发言人汪文斌是在媒体报道中国法院对MH370乘客亲属提起的责任诉讼举行首次听证会后发表上述言论的。

Reporting by Beijing newsroom; Editing by Tom Hogue翻译:北京新闻编辑室报道；汤姆·霍格编辑
item.author: Reuters

item.title: 英国希望吸引中国汽车制造商投资-部长
item.description:
Britain's investment minister on Monday said he was working to attract Chinese car manufacturers to build a factory in the country and that investment from China was crucial to meeting environmental targets.翻译:英国投资大臣周一表示，他正在努力吸引中国汽车制造商在该国建厂，来自中国的投资对于实现环境目标至关重要。

Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's appointment of former British leader David Cameron as foreign minister earlier this month caused concern among some lawmakers in his Conservative Party about what it would mean for the government's approach to China.翻译:英国首相里希·苏纳克本月早些时候任命英国前领导人戴维·卡梅伦为外交部长，引起保守党内一些议员的担忧，担心这对政府对华政策意味着什么。

As prime minister, Cameron heralded a "golden era" in relations with China in 2015, something Sunak has said was over.翻译:作为首相，卡梅伦预示着 2015 年与中国关系的“黄金时代”，而苏纳克则表示这一时代已经结束。

At a foreign direct investment summit at Hampton Court Palace on Monday, British investment minister Dominic Johnson said commercial talks could run in parallel with political disagreements.翻译:周一在汉普顿宫举行的外国直接投资峰会上，英国投资大臣多米尼克·约翰逊表示，商业谈判可能与政治分歧同时进行。

"Chinese investment is crucial if we're to achieve our net zero goals ... I welcome strong business collaboration between the UK and China when it comes to investing in each other's countries," Johnson told reporters, adding he would rather Chinese cars were made in Britain than imported.翻译:约翰逊对记者表示：“如果我们要实现净零排放目标，中国的投资至关重要……我欢迎英国和中国在彼此国家投资方面开展强有力的商业合作。”他补充说，他希望中国汽车英国制造的比进口的。

"Absolutely, I have an ambition to try and attract a Chinese car manufacturer."翻译:“当然，我有一个雄心勃勃的目标，就是尝试吸引一家中国汽车制造商。”

Sunak reiterated his stance that it was possible to work with China in some areas while protecting Britain's interests in other areas of particular sensitivity.翻译:苏纳克重申了他的立场，即可以在某些领域与中国合作，同时在其他特别敏感领域保护英国的利益。

Britain is re-examining the application of its recently introduced National Security and Investment (NSI) Act that has disproportionately blocked Chinese-backed deals.翻译:英国正在重新审查其最近出台的国家安全与投资（NSI）法案的适用情况，该法案不成比例地阻止了中国支持的交易。

Johnson said he was concerned that the act created an "impression of friction", but that it had only been used to intervene in a small number of deals overall, adding it was right to have a safeguard.翻译:约翰逊表示，他担心该法案会造成“摩擦的印象”，但总体而言，该法案仅被用来干预少数交易，并补充说，采取保障措施是正确的。

Britain has announced several car investments this year, including a new Tata gigafactory and investment by Nissan.翻译:英国今年宣布了多项汽车投资，包括新建塔塔超级工厂和日产汽车的投资。

Asked if he had an update on talks with the European Union to resolve rules of origin tariffs due to come into force on carmakers next year, Johnson said "sadly not".翻译:当被问及与欧盟谈判解决明年对汽车制造商生效的原产地关税规则是否有最新进展时，约翰逊表示“遗憾的是没有”。

"We've been very clear that we need to work with our European partners not to get stuck in rules of origin omelettes, which is unhelpful to both sides," he said. "We want to have sensible, pragmatic outcomes to help our car manufacturers."翻译:他说：“我们非常清楚，我们需要与欧洲伙伴合作，不要陷入煎蛋卷的原产地规则，这对双方都没有帮助。” “我们希望取得明智、务实的成果来帮助我们的汽车制造商。”

Reporting by Alistair Smout; Editing by Alex Richardson翻译:阿利斯泰尔·斯莫特报道；亚历克斯·理查森编辑

item.title: 全球银行排名取消联合信贷银行 (Unicredit) 并上升瑞银 (UBS) 和中国银行
item.description:
The Financial Stability Board (FSB) on Monday removed Italy's UniCredit (CRDI.MI) from the list of global systemically important banks and moved three banks, including Switzerland's UBS (UBSG.S), up a bucket.翻译:金融稳定委员会（FSB）周一将意大利联合信贷银行（CRDI.MI）从全球系统重要性银行名单中删除，并将包括瑞士瑞银集团（UBSG.S）在内的三家银行的排名提升了一个等级。

The G20's FSB began the annual rankings after the global financial crisis, requiring the world's biggest lenders to hold an extra buffer of capital, calibrated across five so-called buckets, and to undergo tougher scrutiny of their operations.翻译:全球金融危机后，二十国集团金融稳定委员会开始进行年度排名，要求全球最大的银行持有额外的资本缓冲，并在五个所谓的“桶”中进行校准，并对其运营进行更严格的审查。

UniCredit, which was the only lender in Italy among those deemed as being of global systemic importance by the FSB, had no comment.翻译:联合信贷银行是意大利唯一一家被金融稳定委员会视为具有全球系统重要性的银行，该银行没有发表评论。

Along with UniCredit, Credit Suisse was removed from the list and China's Bank of Communications (601328.SS) was added for the first time bringing the total number of banks down from 30 in 2022 to 29.翻译:与裕信银行一起，瑞士信贷被从名单中删除，中国交通银行（601328.SS）首次被列入名单，使银行总数从 2022 年的 30 家减少到 29 家。

UBS moved up a bucket after earlier this year taking over Credit Suisse in the first merger of two systemically important banks.翻译:瑞银(UBS)今年早些时候收购瑞士信贷(Credit Suisse)，这是两家具有系统重要性的银行的首次合并，此后，瑞银(UBS)的地位进一步提升。

Agricultural Bank of China and China Construction Bank also moved up from bucket 1 to bucket 2.翻译:中国农业银行和中国建设银行也从第一类上升到第二类。

Reporting by Noele Illien and Giulio Piovaccari, Editing by Louise Heavens and Sharon Singleton翻译:Noele Illien 和 Giulio Piovaccari 报道，Louise Heavens 和 Sharon Singleton 编辑

item.title: 中国公务员考试报名人数创历史新高，希望就业有保障
item.description:
More than three million people took China's annual civil service exam on the weekend, state media reported on Monday, a record number that underscores young people's concerns about getting a secure job in a rocky economy.翻译:据官方媒体周一报道，周末有超过三百万人参加了中国的年度公务员考试，这一数字创历史新高，突显了年轻人对在动荡的经济中获得稳定工作的担忧。

With stubbornly high youth employment in the world's second-largest economy, the prospect of a less glamorous career in the civil service is increasingly attractive as private sector job opportunities dwindle.翻译:由于世界第二大经济体的青年就业率居高不下，随着私营部门就业机会的减少， 公务员部门不那么光鲜亮丽的职业前景变得越来越有吸引力。

"After all, the general environment is not good," one user of the Weibo social media platform said of economic prospects as posts about the civil service exam surged.翻译:随着有关公务员考试的帖子激增，微博社交媒体平台的一位用户在谈到经济前景时表示，“毕竟大环境不好。”

"Companies are laying off employees and closing down in large numbers. It is not stable at all, so I have to choose to be a civil servant. The less earnings is fine. At least I won't be unemployed and starve to death."翻译:“企业大量裁员、倒闭，一点也不稳定，所以我只能选择当公务员，收入少一点也好，至少不会失业、饿死。” ”

The exam was held simultaneously in 237 cities across the country on Sunday, the state-run China Daily reported.翻译:据官方媒体《中国日报》报道，考试周日在全国 237 个城市同时举行。

A record high of 39,600 vacancies are up for grabs at central government agencies and affiliated institutions. On average, 77 candidates are competing for every position, the Global Times newspaper reported.翻译:中央国家机关及直属机构空缺职位空缺数量创历史新高，达3.96万个。据《环球时报》报道，平均每个职位都有 77 名候选人竞争。

China is struggling to get its economy back on track after COVID-19 and the government has introduced a rash of policy measures, including strengthening financial support for private companies.翻译:新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 疫情过后，中国正努力让经济重回正轨，政府出台了一系列政策措施，包括加强对私营企业的金融支持。

The number of people trying to get into graduate school has also declined, the China News Network reported, with a researcher at the China National Academy of Educational Sciences citing insecurity about work as a factor.翻译:据中国新闻网报道，试图进入研究生院的人数也有所下降，中国国家教育科学研究院的一位研究员指出，工作不安全感是一个因素。

"For many undergraduate graduates, if they can find a job now, they will definitely prefer to work as soon as possible, said researcher Chu Zhaohui.翻译:“对于很多本科毕业生来说，如果现在能找到工作，他们肯定会更愿意尽快工作。”储朝晖研究员表示。

"Many people's expectations of finding a job after graduate school are relatively low."翻译:“许多人对研究生毕业后找到工作的期望相对较低。”

The Global Times reported that the number of civil service jobs had increased for the past five years. Last year, nearly 2.6 million candidates competed for 37,100 vacancies.翻译:据《环球时报》报道，过去五年来，公务员职位数量有所增加。去年，近260万名候选人竞争了37,100个职位空缺。

Reporting by Bernard Orr; Additional reporting by Beijing and Shanghai newsrooms; Editing by Robert Birsel翻译:伯纳德·奥尔报道；北京和上海新闻编辑室的补充报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔编辑

item.title: 北京对台湾反对派分裂感到担忧，各党派继续攻击与中国的关系
item.description:
Beijing is fretting that a split in Taiwan's opposition could pave the way for the island's ruling party - which the Chinese government despises - to stay in power, as China took centre stage in election campaigning over the weekend.翻译:北京担心，随着中国在周末的竞选活动中占据中心地位，台湾反对派的分裂可能会为中国政府所鄙视的台湾执政党继续掌权铺平道路。

China, which claims Taiwan as its own territory, looms large over the Jan. 13 presidential and parliamentary election as it has ramped up military pressure against the island.翻译:中国声称台湾是自己的领土，并加大了对台湾的军事压力，在 1 月 13 日的总统和议会选举中显得尤为突出。

Last week, negotiations for a united presidential ticket between the two main opposition parties, which seek closer ties with China, imploded, giving a boost to the ruling Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), already leading opinion polls.翻译:上周，寻求与中国建立更密切关系的两个主要反对党之间关于统一总统候选人的谈判破裂，这给已经在民意调查中领先的执政党民进党(DPP)带来了提振。

China's official response so far has been a brief statement from its Taiwan Affairs Office late Friday saying it hopes the election result will help maintain peace and stability, and reiterating that Taiwan faces "a choice between war and peace".翻译:迄今为止，中国官方的回应是国台办周五晚间发表的一份简短声明，称希望选举结果有助于维护和平与稳定，并重申台湾面临“战争与和平的选择”。

But on Chinese social media, the drama has been followed with a sense of despair at the opposition's disunity.翻译:但在中国社交媒体上，这部戏剧引发了对反对派不团结的绝望感。

Zhang Xuesong, director of strategic research at Chinese think tank CICG Asia-Pacific, wrote on his Weibo social media account that the disintegration of the talks was a "loss for cross-Taiwan Strait peace".翻译:中国智库CICG亚太战略研究部主任张雪松在其微博社交媒体账户上写道，会谈破裂是“台海和平的损失”。

"That was an extremely frustrating day," he added. "Of course, the only thing that gives us confidence is that Taiwan is one step closer to finally being reunified."翻译:“那是极其令人沮丧的一天，”他补充道。 “当然，唯一让我们有信心的是台湾距离最终统一又近了一步。”

Other Chinese Weibo accounts that follow Taiwan have been similarly despondent.翻译:其他关注台湾的中国微博账户也同样令人沮丧。

State-run Shenzhen Television wrote that the breakdown in talks signalled "a chaotic battle" to come in the election.翻译:国营深圳电视台写道，谈判破裂预示着选举将出现“一场混乱的战斗”。

One Chinese Weibo user wrote simply: "I saw news that the talks broke down, and now I've lost hope."翻译:一位中国微博用户简单地写道：“我看到谈判破裂的消息，现在我失去了希望。”

The DPP has defied Chinese pressure. Beijing views DPP presidential candidate Lai Ching-te as a separatist and has rebuffed repeated offers of talks from both him and Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen.翻译:民进党不顾中国的压力。北京将民进党总统候选人赖清德视为分裂分子，并拒绝了他和台湾总统蔡英文多次提出的会谈建议。

Speaking at a campaign rally on Sunday night in Taipei's sister city New Taipei, Lai said that if Taiwan accepts it is part of China - Beijing's bottom line for talks - it will lose sovereignty.翻译:周日晚上，黎智英在台北姐妹城市新北举行的竞选集会上发表讲话时表示，如果台湾承认自己是中国的一部分——北京谈判的底线——它将失去主权。

"With no sovereignty, you will have no ownership over your land, your homes," Lai said.翻译:“没有主权，你就没有对你的土地、你的家园的所有权，”赖说。

Hou Yu-ih, the candidate for Taiwan's largest opposition party, the Kuomintang (KMT), told his supporters that a vote for Lai was a vote for war and only he could bring peace. Lai and the DPP strongly dispute that point of view.翻译:台湾最大反对党国民党的候选人侯裕义告诉他的支持者，投票给黎智英就是投票给战争，只有他才能带来和平。赖和民进党强烈反对这一观点。

On Monday, China's Taiwan Affairs Office repeated its attacks on Lai and running mate Hsiao Bi-khim, formerly Taiwan's de facto ambassador to the United States.翻译:周一，中国台湾事务办公室再次攻击赖智和竞选搭档、台湾前驻美大使萧美琴。

Lai and Hsiao "distorted facts and downplayed the harmfulness and danger of 'Taiwan independence' separatist activities to deceive voters in the 2024 leadership election in Taiwan", it said.翻译:赖、萧“在台湾2024年领导人选举中歪曲事实、淡化‘台独’分裂活动的危害性和危险性，欺骗选民”。

Opinion polls since the opposition talks collapsed have given a mixed picture.翻译:自反对派谈判破裂以来的民意调查显示的情况好坏参半。

The Taiwanese Public Opinion Foundation said that just more than half of respondents to the question of who they regarded as having the "best prospects" of winning answered Lai.翻译:台湾民意基金会表示，在被问到“谁最有可能获胜”的问题上，只有一半以上的受访者回答了黎智英。

Television station ETtoday put Lai at about 35%, with Hou nipping at his heels with 33% and former Taipei mayor Ko Wen-je from the small Taiwan People's Party at 21%.翻译:ETtoday 电视台认为赖智民的支持率约为 35%，侯孝贤以 33% 紧随其后，台湾人民党的前台北市长柯文哲则为 21%。

A split opposition gives Lai an increased chance of victory in Taiwan's first-past-the-post system. In 2020's election, the DPP won in a landslide, taking 56% of the vote, but only had to face one main opponent, the KMT's Han Kuo-yu.翻译:反对派的分裂让赖智在台湾的简单当选制中获胜的机会增加。 2020年大选，民进党以56%的选票以压倒性优势获胜，但只面对一个主要对手，即国民党的韩国瑜。

Reporting by Beijing newsroom and Ben Blanchard; Editing by Gerry Doyle翻译:北京新闻编辑室和本·布兰查德的报道；格里·多伊尔编辑

item.title: 月底中国货币市场出现流动性紧张迹象
item.description:
Cash conditions in China's money market showed signs of tightness on Monday, as market participants grew cautious about month-end demand and a recent liquidity squeeze remained fresh in memory.翻译:周一，中国货币市场的现金状况显示出紧张迹象，市场参与者对月末需求变得谨慎，而且近期的流动性紧缩仍记忆犹新。

Despite fresh liquidity injections by the central bank to calm the market, traders and analysts said borrowing costs for the funds that could help financial institutions, especially non-banks, to tide over the critical month-end period remained high.翻译:尽管央行注入新的流动性以安抚市场，但交易员和分析师表示，有助于金融机构（尤其是非银行机构）度过关键月末时期的资金借贷成本仍然很高。

The price of the benchmark seven-day repos traded in the interbank market, hit a high of 2.8% on Monday, the highest level since Oct. 31. Meanwhile, the borrowing cost of such repos for non-bank financial institutions was about 3.5%, according to traders.翻译:银行间市场基准7天回购价格周一触及2.8%高点，创10月31日以来最高水平。同时，非银行金融机构此类回购的借贷成本约为3.5%据贸易商称。

"Money that can help span the month-end has tightening bias, and it's expensive for non-banks," said a trader at a Chinese bank.翻译:一家中资银行的交易员表示，“能够帮助渡过月底的资金存在紧缩倾向，而且对于非银行机构而言成本高昂。”

Some traders also said general sentiment was cautious due largely to fears of another cash crunch.翻译:一些交易员还表示，总体情绪持谨慎态度，主要是因为担心再次出现现金紧缩。

Routine month-end demand for cash in China's banking system snowballed into a scramble on Oct. 31 that pushed short-term funding rates as high as 50% in some cases, an incident that prompted the authorities to investigate.翻译:10月31日，中国银行系统的例行月末现金需求如滚雪球般加剧，导致短期融资利率在某些情况下高达50%，这一事件促使当局展开调查。

"The interbank money market now relies heavily on reverse repos, and bank's willingness to lend to their peers is low, and this may be one of the factors that triggers fluctuations in the funding costs towards the month-end," Liu Yu, analyst at GF Securities.翻译:“现在银行间货币市场严重依赖逆回购，银行向同业放贷的意愿较低，这可能是引发月底融资成本波动的因素之一。”广发证券。

The People's Bank of China (PBOC) injected a net 296 billion yuan ($41.05 billion) through reverse repos in open market operations on Monday, the third straight session of net cash offerings into the financial system.翻译:周一，中国人民银行（PBOC）通过公开市场操作逆回购净注入人民币2,960亿元（合410.5亿美元），这是连续第三个交易日向金融体系净注入现金。

The interest rate on one-year AAA-rated negotiable certificates of deposit (NCDs) , which measures short-term interbank borrowing costs, has been persistently trading higher to hit an over seven-month high of 2.6279%.翻译:衡量短期银行间借贷成本的一年期AAA级可转让存款证（NCD）利率持续走高，触及七个多月高点2.6279%。

NCDs has been a popular short-term debt instrument used by financial institutions in the interbank market for financing.翻译:非传染性疾病一直是金融机构在银行间市场融资的热门短期债务工具。

Sources told Reuters earlier this month that China's central bank asked some lenders to cap interest rates on an interbank debt instrument, referring to the rising short-term yields on bank debt and strains in funding markets.翻译:消息人士本月早些时候告诉路透社，中国央行要求一些银行限制银行间债务工具的利率，指的是银行债务短期收益率上升和融资市场紧张。

($1 = 7.2111 Chinese yuan)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2111 人民币）
